lines.text: You and your wife are expected for dinner.
My wife won't be coming.
Oh, I trust she is not ill?
She's not ill, she's a cheap, vulgar slut.
Ja, I have heard this.
Ladies and gentlemen, I can envision a day when the brains of brilliant men can be kept alive in the bodies of dumb people.
Can I get you anything more, doctor? I'm about to retire.
Really? You seem so young.
As you know, my research has advanced to a point where I can put her mind into the body of a gorilla.
I couldn't fuck a gorilla.
Sounds like a subdural hematoma to me.
Oh, it does, does it? Well, it's not your job to diagnose.
But I thought...
You thought, you thought. Just go. Three years of nursery school and you think you know it all. Well, you're still wet behind the ears. It's not a subdural hematoma. It's *epidural*. Ha.

[Dr. Hfuhruhurr has driven them to his house, where Ramon and the housekeeper are on the porch, smiling happily to welcome the bride]
There it is, darling. Your new home. The House of Hfuhruhurr.
What are those assholes doing on the porch?
Those aren't assholes. It's pronounced *azaleas*.
You. You're the elevator killer. Merv Griffin.
Yeah.
Why?

I don't know. I've always just loved to kill. I really enjoyed it. But then I got famous, and - it's just too hard for me. And so many witnesses. I mean, *everybody* recognized me. I couldn't even lurk anymore. I'd hear, "Who's that lurking over there? Isn't that Merv Griffin?" So I came to Europe to kill. And it's really worked out very well for me.
Into the mud, scum queen.
Damn your drunk tests are hard.

[counting in a neurological test after Delores placed the brain in an oven to boil]
One, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight, ten.
You. You cooked her nines! Out! Out of my house! Out of my life!
Now, juggle these, do a tap dance, and sing the Catalina Magdalena Lupensteiner Wallabeiner song. Goddam, your drunk tests are hard!
Goddam, your drunk tests are hard!
The Complete Poems of John Lillison, England's greatest one-armed poet.
He wrote 'In Dillman's Grove' and 'Pointy Birds.' O pointy birds, o pointy pointy, anoint my head, anointy-nointy.
[first lines]

[in surgery]
Check the art line. You're hyperventilating the patient.
No doctor.
Ready the bone wax. Metzenbaum scissors.
Metzenbaum scissors.

[meowing]
Get that cat out of here.
Yes sir.
Ready to close. Remove the Wietlander Retractor.
Pre-closure doctor.
Remove the rating clip, for God's sake!
What are they saying?
They are just saying 'murmur, murmur, murmur.'
You mean it's just sort of a general murmur?
Yeah. Murmur.
Oh.
[to the crowd]
You may *murmur* all you like.

[distinctly]
Murmur, murmur, murmur, murmur, murmur.
I wanted to inform the Doctor of her passing.
Passing what?
Dolores, I am making a citizen's divorce.

[laughing]
What?
By the powers vested in me, I hereby declare our marriage null and void! E pluribus unum!
You are playing God.
*Somebody* has to.
I get so excited when you get angry. It makes me feel so much closer to the reading of the will.
The only time we doctors should accept death is when it's caused by our own incompetence.
Nonsense. If the murder of twelve innocent people can help save one human life, it will have been worth it.
Well, Dr. Beckerman was murdered in Europe - you know that.
Exactly. Not only is he dead, he's six thousand miles away.
If you lay one finger on me, I'll kill you.
You kill me and I'll see that you never work in this town again.
Nobody's going to keep me from working in this town.
I can't.
Can't what?
I can't inject you with window cleaner.
I don't mind. Hey, what does it do anyway?
It causes your brain to die last.
I don't mind.
I'll get you for this, you nigger kike wop.
Doctor, were you interested in science as a child?

I don't know if I was interested so much in the science as I was in the slime that goes along with it. Snakes and frogs. When I saw how slimy the human brain was, I knew that's what I wanted to do with the rest of my life.
I don't think there's a girl floating in any jar anywhere who's as happy as I am. Michael, you do so much for me, and I do nothing for you.
Are you out of your head?
[He winces]

Sorry, I forgot. As far as I'm concerned, you're the most complete woman I've ever known. All my life, I wanted women with great bodies, women who were "Tens." Now, for the first time, I'm aroused by a mind.
[He gazes lovingly at the brain in the jar]

[Dr. Hruhruhurr places a doll resembling Rebecca on the dash board]
Is that her?
No. That's just a statue of her.
Would you read that back to me? I'm afraid that might make me sound pompous to your readers.
'My brilliant research in brain transplantation is unsurpassed, and will probably make my name live beyond eternity'.
Well, that's all right. Take out the 'probably'. It makes me sound wishy-washy.
[Sees all the brains in Dr Necessiter's lab]
I've never seen so many brains out of their heads before! I feel like a kid in a candy store.

[Dr. Hfuhruhurr is puffing a cigarette in bed after what was presumably great foreplay]
Never in my wildest imagination, I *ever* thought it could be like that. That was the most exciting sexual encounter - without actually having it - that I ever, almost had.
Dr. Huffer?
It's pronounced "Hfuhruhurr".
She just doesn't have any... "VA-VOOOOOM"!
Ouch! My balls!
I can't wait till next Thursday.
Today is Monday.
I know, but my headache should be gone by then.
I appreciate you letting me observe that brain operation today.
It would have been more complicated if it had needed one but since you wanted to observe my technique...
Well, the operations seems to be a success. But the doctor died.
Little girl.
Yes sir.
I want you to do something very important, alright?
OK.

I want you to run home and I want you to call the E.R. of North Bank General Hospital, 932-1000. Tell them to set up OR6 immediately and contact anesthesiologist Isadore Turek 472-2112 beep 12. Have him send an ambulance with a paramedic crew, light IV, D5NW-KVO. You got it?
E.R. North Bank General Hospital 932-1000. Setup OR6. Contact anesthesiologist Isadore Turek 472-2112 beep 12. Ambulance with paramedics and light IV, D5NW and KVO.
That's good.
Sounds like a subdural hematoma to me.
Oh it does, does it? Well, it's not your job to diagnose!
But I thought...

You thought, you thought... just go! Three years of nursery school and you think you know it all. Well you're still wet behind the ears. It's not subdural hematoma, it's epidural! Ha! God damn that makes me mad!

[to the nurse while operating Dolores, whose perfect breast is showing]
Cover her breasts. I'm a man, flesh and blood.
[the scientists pull up in a car in front of a modern condominium building]
What's the matter?
Oh, you have to forgive me. It's just that, being here in Austria, meeting a scientist with your interests, I half expected your laboratory to be in a castle, not a condo.

[Dr. Necessiter opens his room with his key and swings the door wide open]
You mean like this?
[His place is decorated with rough rock walls and flagstone floors, candles and candelabras, an interior drawbridge, wing chairs, hanging banners, and the like]

[Amazed on seeing the castle-like interior of Dr. Necessiter's condo]
Leapin' lizards!
Yes, we have those.
[On the left wall, two iguanas are hanging out, and two smaller green lizards leap from off camera to join them]
I know there's something weird going on with you and that brain!

[defensively]
It's not weird!

[Counting in a neurological test after being placed in an oven]
One, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight, ten.
My god, you've cooked her nines!
If you're uncomfortable with any of this... give me a sign?
[the painting starts spinning wildly and the light fixtures give off flames]
NOOO! NOOOO! NOOOOO!
You're going in the closet.
By the way, I fired Ramon yesterday.
Ramon? Ramon is such a fine man. What did he do?
He came up behind me and he grabbed my breasts.
What? I haven't even done that yet.
Into the mud, Scum-Queen!
